cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then forecast to move north over Louisiana and turn northeast across Mississippi.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Houma/Grand Isle and the Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches extend to the Florida west-central coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama/Florida border; Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the AL/FL border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty squalls possible, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Tampa Bay/Port Manatee area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent outer-band showers; rainfall totals generally 1–2 inches, locally higher in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip currents along the west-central Florida coast.
